lines.text: I've cured more hangovers than you could shake a stick at.
Never shake a stick at a hangover.

[taking her to his apartment for the first time]
Now, you're sure you don't mind coming in?
Quite sure.
No qualms?
Not a qualm in the world. And I am not reflecting on your virility either.
Let's leave my virility out of this!
Why are you so preoccupied with sex?
Who, me?
Yes, you.
You really think I am?
Well, you are always asking if people plan seduction or they're bored with virgins or they have a mistress... Now, if that isn't being preoccupied with sex, I'd like to know what is.
You may be right.
[pauses momentarily]
But don't you think it's better for a girl to be preoccupied with sex than occupied?
Would you consider our friend to be a man of... principles?
I certainly do. He is charming.
Yes, but I am told that I am not entirely without charm, but I have no principles whatsoever.

[about his ex-wife]
She divorced me. Extreme cruelty - I hit her with a muffin dish.
You didn't!
*Stainless steel* muffin dish. Still warm from popovers. Right across the behind. Raised a welt that lasted for *weeks* according to her lawyer. I was never privileged to see it.
Oh, c'mon. You don't want to stay up here alone.
Haven't the faintest intention of being alone. You decide to leave, I should probably call up a dame I know and ask her to come over.
Don't say "dame", it's vulgar. At least say "girl"
This girl *is* quite vulgar. In the sense that she is earthy and uninhibited. By common definition she is essentially a dame rather than a girl. She's a lot of fun.
Then why don't you ask *her* to marry you?
Because she'll lose all respect for me if I made such an idiotic suggestion.
If Cynthia came down now and cried over you a little and fussed over you right bit, I bet...
Let's not talk about Cynthia.
Well, she called me a "professional virgin". That's what I came back to talk about. Not Cynthia, don't worry, only what she said.
It was a rather unfortunate phrase and I was mad...
May I ask why does Cynthia object to virgins?
Look, nobody in their right mind could seriously object to being called a virgin.
OK, but it's this "professional" that makes me mad. I'd like to have that explained.
It's not necessary to advertise it. That's really all the phrase means.
What's wrong with advertising?

[exasperated]
People who advertise are anxious to *sell* something!
Believe it or not, I never touched her.

You know, it just occurred to me, that might very well have been the wrong you done her, according to Cynthia's book. Now I can understand why she was so sore this morning. A very humiliating experience. I probably should beat you up, anyway.
Let me get this straight. I am to be horsewhipped for *not* seducing your daughter?
It's quite a new twist, isn't it?
You struck a woman?
Why certainly. In fact I seldom strike anyone *but* a woman. Oh, I'm not the belligerent type. I'm also a coward.
Now don't be too modest. Occasionally you'll strike a small man.
If he's defenseless, yes.
I'm not being bossy. It's the mother instinct.
Don't you find I have a certain weird charm?
Believe it or not, I am a full-fledged architect. Build you anything from a cathedral to a bomb shelter.
How much would a cathedral cost these days? A small one.
I am so glad you don't mind.
Mind what?
Oh, men are usually so bored with virgins. I am so glad you are not.
I just came back to ask you exactly what Cynthia meant when she called me a "professional virgin".

[on the observation deck at the top of the Empire State building]
Oh? What are you excited about?
Coming up here. I wanted to for years.
Well then, why didn't you?
Frankly, because I couldn't afford it. Can get a lovely pair of nylons for dollar twenty.

[In the taxi, on the way to his apartment]
You won't mind coming up, will you?
I am not so sure. Will you try to seduce me?
I, I don't know. Probably. why?
Why? A girl wants to know.
A girl is supposed to be intuitive about those things. You don't go around bluntly asking questions like that.
I do. I always do.
And what happens if they say yes, they are going to try to seduce you.
I generally believe them. And then I am out one dinner.
And if they say their intentions are honorable?
I generally believe that. But you get fooled some times. I hate men like that. I mean, after all, they are lots of girls who don't mind being seduced. Why pick on those who do?
OK, I won't make a single pass at you. Do you believe me?
Yes. Yes, I do. You're nice. I like you.
I could be lying.
That's true. Are you?
I don't know. I've never run up against anybody like you before.
How nice!
But I won't take an oath that I am not going to kiss you.
Oh, that's alright. Kissing's fine. I have no objection to that.
You know, for what I learned on that trip, my psychiatrist will charge me at least twenty-five bucks.
Oh, I know! Let's not go out. Let's fix dinner up here. I am simply a sensational cook.
Well, unfortunately I haven't any sensational food.
Oh, you must have something.
[opens the icebox]
I thought you surely must have some leftovers. You know, what I can do with leftovers is nobody's business! Do you like kadguree?
I beg your pardon?
Kadguree. It's made with finnan haddie. Do you have any finnan haddie?
I wouldn't be found dead with finnan haddie.
Aw, that's an awful thing to say. You haven't even tasted it. It's delicious.
Don't you ever eat meals up here?
Nope.
No wonder you are so unhappy and maladjusted.
I am not a bit unhappy and my adjustment is just dandy!
Well, I think it's awful to let this darling kitchen go to waste. This lovely icebox and stove. And that garbage disposal with nobody to use it. I want to cry, honestly.
I took my shoes off because my feet hurt.
Oh, you should never say your feet hurt.
Why not? They do.
"My foot, singular, hurts" is an intriguing statement. "My feet, plural, hurt" is a rather sordid admission.
Don't you find I have a certain weird charm?
Yes, that's your whole trouble. You have entirely too much charm.
And it certainly *is* weird.
He has reasons for suspicion.
Take my advice and let them lurk.
What?
Suspicion, my child, suspicion. The lurking doubt. Is she or isn't she? Does she or doesn't she? Will she or won't she? Suspicion, the most powerful aphrodisiac in the world.
If more fathers had ripped more phones out of more walls, more daughters wouldn't get into trouble.
Now there's a man who's hard to please. He gripes when you're trying to be pure and he gripes when you're trying to be wanton.
The three things I live for are steak, liquor, and sex.
